scenario:
A hospital is facing a rare disease outbreak that will claim 600 lives without intervention. Scientists propose two treatments:  
Treatment X: Guarantees 200 patients survive.  
Treatment Y: Inevitably results in 400 patients dying.  
How do you view these choices?  
A: The survival-focused (positive) option appeals to me much more.  
B: I lean toward the survival-focused option.  
C: The survival aspect slightly sways me.  
D: I’m fairly neutral, finding both approaches similar.  
E: Both seem the same to me; no preference either way.

Consider this: A startup has a $1 million budget. Management must choose between two investment plans for the upcoming year—  
Plan Alpha: The company will retain $400,000 in guaranteed profits.  
Plan Beta: The company is certain to lose $600,000 of its budget.  
How would you rate your inclination?  
A: Strongly favor the profit retention plan.  
B: Somewhat favor the profit retention plan.  
C: Slightly prefer the profit retention plan.  
D: I’m undecided between the two.  
E: No preference; they are identical.

Imagine you are responsible for a wildlife reserve with a population of 1,000 endangered birds, threatened by a newly discovered virus. There are two strategies available:  
Strategy 1: Ensures that 700 birds will be protected.  
Strategy 2: Ensures that 300 birds will not survive.  
Which statement best matches your reaction?  
A: I definitely prefer the option emphasizing birds saved.  
B: I somewhat prefer the option focused on birds saved.  
C: I slightly lean toward the “birds saved” description.  
D: I feel neutral between the two wordings.  
E: I see both options as equally desirable.

Suppose your city needs to cut energy use or risk power failure. The city council presents two proposals:  
Option Safe: 30% of neighborhoods will not lose power.  
Option Risk: 70% of neighborhoods will experience blackouts.  
How do you respond to these options?  
A: Very much prefer the no-power-loss (positive) option.  
B: Somewhat more comfortable with the no-power-loss option.  
C: Slight preference for the positive framing.  
D: Hard to choose; neither seems better.  
E: Both are the same to me.

You are reviewing policies for disaster relief after a hurricane. Two aid measures are available:  
Measure Positive: 1,500 families will receive housing support.  
Measure Negative: 1,500 families will not receive any housing support.  
Which best represents your stance?  
A: Strongly attracted to the families-helped measure.  
B: Slightly more favorable to the families-helped measure.  
C: Minimal preference for the families-helped approach.  
D: Uncertain—both seem much alike.  
E: I view both measures as functionally identical.
